title: Christian Pulisic confident his 'scoring touch' will be back soon after crucial role in Chelsea win
text:
Christian Pulisic is confident he will rediscover his 'scoring touch' after an influential cameo performance against Newcastle.

The 21-year-old has struggled for game time for his new club since his £58million move from Borussia Dortmund this summer, with other young players flourishing under manager Frank Lampard.

But the American was introduced on the hour mark against the Magpies and produced a driving run and pass which eventually allowed Marcos Alonso to score the game's only goal.

Christian Pulisic is confident he will find his 'scoring touch' after a strong cameo vs Newcastle

Speaking after the game, Pulisic said he feels confident he can use this promising performance as a platform to build on in the coming weeks.

'It was a really good game, happy for the team, had a strong performance, they defended really well, and I was happy to make an impact,' Pulisic told ESPN after the match.

'(Lampard) told me to do exactly what I'm doing now, continue to train hard, when I get my opportunity I have to take it.'

Pulisic scored 19 goals and recorded 28 assists for Dortmund during his three year stint at the club but is still waiting for his first goal for the London club.

But the now-Chelsea man had the chance to mark the performance a goal after Mateo Kovacic had played him through on goal, but unselfishly decided to square it to Tammy Abraham only for fellow American DeAndre Yedlin to make a goal-saving block.

The American's strong run and pass set up Marcos Alonso to score the game's only goal

'I was going to shoot last-second, but I saw Tammy wide open and then DeAndre made an unbelievable block, so maybe I should have shot it,' the winger admitted.

'I just don't have that scoring touch but I know it will come back.'

The return of highly-rated winger Callum Hudson-Odoi to the Chelsea team has seemingly pushed Pulisic further down the pecking order for the Blues, but Lampard hinted after the game that we will start to see more of the American in the coming weeks.

'I am really pleased for him,' Lampard said after a victory that lifted his side into the top four of the Premier League.

'He is a hot topic because of his national team. Everyone has got carried away with the short term but in the long term there is a lot more to come.

'I am delighted for him. He will feel good about that and he should do.'
description: Christian Pulisic is confident he will rediscover his 'scoring touch' after an influential cameo performance against Newcastle. The American has struggled for game time this season.
